titleStmt.title: Finite Sample Convergence Rates of Zero-Order Stochastic Optimization Methods

affiliation.orgName: Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

analytic.title: Finite Sample Convergence Rates of Zero-Order Stochastic Optimization Methods

abstract.p: We consider derivative-free algorithms for stochastic optimization problems that use only noisy function values rather than gradients, analyzing their finite-sample convergence rates. We show that if pairs of function values are available, algorithms that use gradient estimates based on random perturbations suffer a factor of at most âˆš d in convergence rate over traditional stochastic gradient methods, where d is the problem dimension. We complement our algorithmic development with information-theoretic lower bounds on the minimax convergence rate of such problems, which show that our bounds are sharp with respect to all problem-dependent quantities: they cannot be improved by more than constant factors.
